entries.name: Oversized
entries: A weapon with the oversized property is larger than even the largest conventional weapon. Only individuals with exceptional strength can hope to wield one efficiently.

An oversized weapon counts also as a {@itemproperty heavy} weapon (PHB p. 147); with the following changes. Both Small and Medium creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls with oversized weapons. A Medium creature does not have disadvantage if its Strength score is 20 or greater.

If a damage value in parenthesis appears with the oversized property, a Large creature may wield the weapon in one or two hands. The oversized damage value is used if the creature wields the weapon in two hands.

This is intended to make weapons for Large player character races. Normally a Large-sized weapon deals double the damage die (e.g. a large greataxe deals 2d12 instead of 1d12) but this might be considered overpowered for a player. When designing oversized weapons,the damage can be one step or more greater than a martial weapon, but must be less than a Large weapon.

entries.name: Defensive
entries: All attack rolls made with weapons that have the defensive property suffer a -1 penalty. However, when a creature attacks with a weapon with this property on its turn or during its reaction, it gains +1 to its AC until the end of its next turn.

In melee weapons, this defensive quality could come from a protective hilt or a lighter construction, allowing for quicker movements; on ranged weapons, it could come from a wide guard at the front of the weapon or a camouflaged cover.

entries.name: Brace
entries: Any weapon with this property always deals Maximum damage when it hits a mount - provided its wielder uses half their movement before taking the attack action.

When used as an held action to attack a creature on a mount or attempting a charge action targeting the wielder or moving through its threatened range, the wielder makes their attack on a successful attack the weapon deals maximum damage and the mount or creature charging is halted and their charge attack automatically misses.

entries.name: Aiming
entries: Weapons with the aiming property may take an action gain a +2 bonus and make a single ranged attack. However, when a creature uses a weapon with this property, it suffers a -2 penalty to its AC until the start of its next turn.

Longbows might gain this quality through the use of weights and sights attached to the bow scopes, whilst light and heavy crossbows might achieve it by having tripods attached to the bottom of the barrel.

entries.name: Bleeder
entries: When hit by a weapon with the bleeder property the target gains the Bleeding condition and the Target takes an additional point of damage of the weapon's type at the start of its next turn until they make a Constitution Save versus (base DC 12 (+ any magical bonuses)), are magical healed, or have

entries.name: Entnagle
entries: Some weapons, particularly those with lengths of rope or chains, are designed to wrap around a foe's weapon or limbs.

A creature can use an attack with such a weapon to entangle the target's weapon or limbs. The attacker makes an attack roll contested by the target's Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check or Dexterity ({@skill Acrobatics}) check. The target has advantage on its ability check if it is larger than the attacking creature, or disadvantage if it is smaller. If the attacker wins the contest, the attack causes no damage or other ill effect, but becomes entangled by the attacker.

An entangled creature has disadvantage on attack rolls until the attacker ends the entanglement with a bonus action; the attacker drops their weapon or the attacker is {@condition incapacitated}; forced movement causes the attacker and target apart beyond the reach of the weapon; or the target uses its action to escape (as though {@condition grappled}). While entangled, neither the attacker nor the target can move apart beyond the reach of the weapon.
While the attacker is entangling the target's weapon, it has advantage on subsequent attempts to disarm the target (see DMG p. 271)

items: A creature with the bleeding condition sustains ongoing stacking damage.
Undead, Constructs & Oozes are immune to bleeding.
A creature that has the bleeding condition that drops to 0 hp makes their Death Saves at disadvantage.
The condition is removed by: taking a (short/long) rest, recieving any healing (magical or mundane), or taking an action to staunch the wound.

On a Investigate (DC 15) they'll become aware of the quill's problematic behavior.
Ripped and torn mail links.  They seem to glow with a royal brilliance, but do not emit any actual light.
Seaglass Earring
sealed envelope made of red leather you haven’t been able to open. It smells of campfire.
Seven small beads of sandstone on a string, all different colors.
Shell The shell - when placed upon their ear - softly plays (Perception DC 12) popular music for that race
Shrunken Head
Some frog legs made of ivory  that bounce around randomly.
Some random objects such as bones or stones that always come back together when destroyed
Some vials of liquid  that create moss on anything they touch. This moss keeps growing and will eventually cover the whole thing. Then the moss withers and flakes off.
Statue of Kobold An incredibly ugly kobold statue that you can't get rid of. If you sell it, leave it or give it away it always reappears next to your bed staring at you the next morning.

Stone This appears to be a normal stone, but when it is rubbed the stone produces the smell a specific type of baked good (pie, bread, etc) for 60ft for half an hour. While it's in effect scent based Perception checks are at absolute disadvantage. (Consider it 'double disadvantage).

Stoneware Beer Stein A stoneware beer stein with a pewter lid. A dwarf female fighting a Quaggoth decorates the stein, and the lid’s thumb lever is in the shape of the dwarf standing over the slain creature.
The blade of a huge axe  that feels insanely heavy to any size below huge, but huge think it is as light as a feather.
The blade of an ancient sword.  A mysterious coat of arms is carved into it.
The branch of a tree that caught fire when you were nearby.
The desiccated body of a small eight-legged black lizard.
The eye of a cat For some reason it commonly looks around at anything powerful.
The porcelain turtle of doubt.  It's a rabbit statue but for some reason everyone thinks it's really a turtle.
The symbol of a powerful religion covered in soot that stays no matter how much it is cleaned.
Three gems Like Ioun stones, they circle around a creatures head, sparkling and softing chiming - if the creature is of royal blood - granting such Advantage on Charisma based skills while active.
Zurkhwood comb A zurkhwood comb carved to look like a stylized mustache.
An old, worn smith's hammer. Its head is always hot to the touch.
Chicken Feather A feather, from a chicken.. don't overthink this.
small silver bell sound like quiet, distant thunder when it's struck.
A vial shaped like a cylinder.  Any liquid put inside gets tainted blue and gains a slight taste like blue raspberry.
An eye-sized blue pearl floats in salt water.
blank piece of wet parchment never seems to dry.
Small puzzle box made of brass slightly warm to the touch.
A clockwork finch flaps its wings in the presence of a breeze.
A conch shell always damp and constantly drips saltwater.
A glass pendant with a hole in the center  A mild breeze always blows out of the hole
A handful of caltrops When they touch the ground, begin to make “sad puppy noises”
A pair of silver slippers (or ruby if you want the movie version) Sparkle when worn and the heels clicked together
A Tiny Golden Egg cannot be cracked or broken
An impossibly sharp pen  Always be in the owner’s pocket when they reach into it.
Flint and steel when used to start a fire, creates a random colored flame.
Half of a palm-sized geode  pulses dimly with purple light.
hourglass  sands pour upward instead of downward.

Ice Diamond This diamond is found sumberged in crushed ice in a specially sealed box. If it is removed from the ice it will gradually change over the next minute until it resembles a grey pebble. If submerged in crushed ice again it will quickly return to its diamond appearance.
Six Fingered Gloves These gloves had room for an extra finger. (A Latin/Spaniard NPC will continue to appear - but not approach the owner of the gloves.)
small vial of black sand glows slightly in the moonlight.
Terracotta Flask A small earthen flask which fills itself each day with cow urine.
pair of tailor’s shears can cut through any kind of leather.
A clear marble slowly rolls toward the nearest source of running water.
A curious talking ebony walking stick, well versed in history and swordplay.
A glass orb replicates yesterday's weather inside itself.
A quarterstaff with a small jade sphere affixed to one end. When swung, the jade leaves a faint trail of color.
A rag intended to be wrapped around the scabbard of a sword It magically whisks away blood and other liquids from a sword as it is sheathed.
A small brass flute adorned with silver wire It is always faintly sounding.
A small collapsible silver cup perspires constantly when opened.
A small metal dragon. If you press it’s tail, it spits a small blue flame.
A stone figure of a snake  changes positions after every full moon
hourglass   tells time with falling mist instead of sand.
Whetstone Is always wet.
A bean When planted, overnight produces a climbable beanstalk that when it seeds, makes one bean
A charred, half-melted pewter clasp glows as if smoldering but releases no heat.
A deep blue piece of flint when struck with steel produces not a spark but a drop of water.
A fist sized rock  that “beats” like a heart.
A fruit  Makes you drowsy after taking a bite, always regenerates (provides no sustenance)
Juggler's Balls If thrown these balls will always make their way back to the thrower's hand before hitting the ground.
A Book Written by a halfling named Heroicus about the intricacies of pony breeding, includes illustrations Gain +10 to animal handling with horses or its kin
A bright crimson felt hat Makes the wearer appear more slender to all that view (illusion) but makes the wearer see themselves as more hefty/fat.
A brown scroll case that can only hold a single spell It can disppear and reappear when bearer utters the word “secrets”
A Compass always points to Mulmaster.
A dark mahogany seed the size of a fist When planted, all flora within 30ft immediately blooms, but they decay when the seed is dug up.
A Doll shaped like a Pixie Its bearer is immune to being knocked back or thrown.
A glass eyeball  looks about of its own accordance, and can roll around.
A Glass Jar with an Ear of Night Hag in embalming fluid If exposed to starlight, all within 200ft will hear the faint sound of children wailing

A Golden Ring affixed with a tiny dark stone chisled into a cats head.  It purs with pleasure and graces the wearer with the use of one instance of Luck, until a short rest, whenever a being with canine bloodlines is slain in its presence.

A love letter written in an ancient and forgotten tongue Attempts to read such causes feelings of homesickness until they make a Wisdom Save (18), until then creatures that read or heard the words (They do not need to know the language) as they have two levels of Exhaustion.
A Mask resembling the visage of an old halfling woman When worn the wearer sees the moment of their birth.
A Pair of crude bracers made of horse hide. The bracers deflect all harmless items thrown at the wearer including ones they wish to catch.
A palm-sized stone with a hole in it  through which can be heard a constantly whispering wind.
A paper fan won't produce a breeze no matter how hard it's waved.
A Petrified red and purple starfish Makes the weare impervious to sea sickness or losing their footing while aboard a seafaring vessel at sea (+10 to Acrobratics checks for such).
A pouch containing an ounce of altered wolfsbane Lycanthropes are drawn to the bearer
A set of dark spectacles  Allows the wearer to see faint aurars of similar colorings encircling individuals who share a common ancestors.
A silver cup inlaid with Elvish Script When filled with wine it performs (+10) a single song that is etherically beautiful, when filled with anything else it scretches and gagles.
A simple metal box Contains a scroll of wish, but only a divine being may open it.
A small glass bird  when set down near water dips its head in as if to get a drink.

A small pot with yellow paste The paste deals 3d6  necrotic damage to oozes when applied, or instantly ends acid/poison/damage effect. Can be applied to a medium sized creature to reverse all ooze attacks until a short or long rest.
A small stone cube  Acts as a magnet when placed against another stone.
A small vial of Vampire's blood All creatures within 5 ft radius that feed on blood are repeled (Must make a Wis 16 Save)
A small wooden doll when held brings back fond memories.
A Wood Lyre with Leaf Motif Plays notes that only those older than 100 can hear
An Easily breakable hairpin made of jade shaped like a dragonfly Allows wearer to see through smoke, fog, and mist as if not there.

Boots of Multiple Steps These plain leather boots seem to have extra padding on the soles to seemingly reduce the niose of the wearer's footsteps. But any wearer will note that every step emits a cocophany of sound that echoes off surfaces that do not exist. In effect, it reduces Stealth (or whatever the games equivalent is), rolls by -10 but anyone hearing the steps have difficulty pinpointing where the sound comes from from the infinitly echoeing steps.
Box of Shadowdust A small black box with a tied down lid. Inside is a greyish powder that screams non-stop when it comes in contact with sunlight.

Hoard-Coin A small metal coin that when flipped it will always land on its side. One per day the coin can be rolled on the floor, where it will roll toward the nearest source of significant precious metal or gems, as a “Locate Object” spell.
yellow gemstone glows dimly when a storm is nearby.
A drinking cup that randomly fills with fresh or salt water. Refilling once emptied.
A large transparent gem when gripped tightly, whispers in Terran.

Fingerless Gloves Anyone that puts on these gloves feels a faint tingling in their fingers. An hour later it will be uncomfortable cramps. A further hour later, intense pain. At this point, if the gloves are removed their fingers will magically disappear.

Purifying Ring A regularlooking copper ring that purifies any liquid that passes through it back in to pure water. Wearing this ring is a bad idea, since it’ll purify the materials out of your blood, returning it to water.
The custom dice rolling action action figure.  It's like a nutcracker that if you put a set of dice in it's hand an pull the lever on the back it always rolls the highest possible outcome.
A small vial of Vampire's blood  always filled with the smell of autumn wind.

Bag of Duplication Put any object that can fit through a 1-foot diameter hole into this bag, and you can draw it back out, plus a duplicate. The duplicate has no value (magical items have no magic, weapons are pot-metal, coins are base metal, jewels are glass, food is non-nutritious, etc.) but they look perfect without a close inspection.

Golden Helmet of Mambrino This item looks like a shaving basin, but when placed on the head of a paladin, grants AC 16. But disadvantage to all Charisma saves and checks. (it still looks like a shaving basin.)
Razor of Logic At a command word, this razor will instantly and safely shave anybody within 60 feet, except the barber who owns of the razor.

The Ivory Truffle Pig This ivory statuette of a pig can be comanded to grow to full size and find the nearest source of food, fresh water, or truffles. It can only remain active for 2 hours a day, split up as the user desires.

Bed of Alarm This bed will instantly wake its occupant if any intruder enters the castle of the original owner. Note that since you don't know where that is, this means it wakes the occupant randomly, any time an animal walks across those ruins, thousands of miles away.
A pipe Smoke that comes from it at times makes phantasmal images for the smoke.
A ring Of a past poweful leader, at times it laughs at your jokes.
A Sealed Jar of Glowing Water The Jar is unbreakable, and hums when shaken
A small crystal snowglobe when shaken, seems to form silhouettes of dancing forms.
A small Hand Held Mirror Will answer mundane questions
A small marble  that randomly changes color.
A small model of a castle  that matches a real one exactly and changes to match new alterations.
A small pocket mirror  slowly fogs over while held.
A small whistle when blown, whispers a name  of a person or place unknown to you, instead of the whistle sound.
A snowglobe Shows you the Feywild version of your current location.
A soft feather When dropped falls like a stone weight (bearer cannot benefit from a feather fall)
A steamer trunk when opened, has your sister inside it, whether you actually remember having one or not.
A stone smoking pipe that never needs lighting.
A Strange Key A heavy, ornate, stone key with unreadable markings. Breaks/Doesn't fit any lock.. but can be used as an improvised magical weapon dealing d6 bludgeoning dmg.
A tea kettle heats itself when filled with water.
A tuning fork made from a dark metal  glows with a pale, white light during thunderstorms.
A vial of red liquid  that moves up or down depending on the current danger.
A woodcutter’s axe the head of which shimmers like downwards-flowing water.
amulet filled with liquid The liquid churns, freezes, or boils to match its wearer's mood.
An old scratched monocle  shows an underwater landscape whenever someone looks through it.
Book Filled with writing that only appears when the book is held underwater.
Broken Dagger This incredibly ornate dagger is snapped in half partway down the blade and is not able to be repaired by any means at all.
Eternal Chessboard Anyone playing chess with this set cannot win or lose a match. It simply goes on and on no matter how many moves the players take.
miniature brass horn silent when played, but fills the air with the scent of warm and exotic spices.
Moon Rock This rock has a strange feeling and is a weird yellow-grey colour. Any inspection suggests magical properties but infact it's completely mundane.
tiny skull of a rabbit whispers scathing insults when nobody is looking.
Whalebone Pipe Beautifully carved in the shape of a ship. It doesn’t come with tobacco, but should you smoke any in it near the waterfront, it can summon a sunken ship.

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): A handful of broken rune sticks in a soft leather bag. When cast, they always spell out their owner's name.

item.name: Lady's coin purse
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Contains two sharp fangs.

item.name: Orb of Slope Detection
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Orb of Slope Detection -
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When placed on the ground it will let you know if the ground has a slope by moving in a downward direction.

item.name: oversized, polished tin belt buckle
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): oversized, polished tin belt buckle
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): An oversized, polished tin belt buckle stamped with the phrase “Everything's Bigger In Mithral Hall“ in large runes.

item.name: A box containing a mold for a cast iron key
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A box containing a mold for a cast iron key

item.name: Planter
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When soil is placed in the pot, the soil will always be perfectly watered for whatever plant grows in it. (if multiple plants are placed in the pot, the first one's climate/water needs are used - the rest may die from under/over watering as the case may be. Double production value of the plant being tended)

item.name: Pocket hand-bellows.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Pocket hand-bellows that were probably meant as a child's toy but are useful for starting fires none-the-less.

item.name: Pocketwatch
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A small and rusty pocketwatch, which is ridiculously hard to open. There’s no reward inside either, just an engraving saying “Time marches on” on one side, and a clock that’s standing still on the other side. (With a persception 18, you can see the clock is moving, but incredibly slow, and... appears to be counting down)

item.name: Potion of Darkvision (Expired)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): An expired potion of darkvision, now just makes everything bright when you take a sip, tastes like dry carrots for some apparent reason.

item.name: Potion of Growth (Expired)
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): An expired potion of growth, now only makes you get slightly bigger when you take a sip, tastes like powdered iron for some apparent reason

item.name: Quill
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This is fine quill with what appears to be a platinum nib. However the weilder is takes 2x (2d4-1) times more time to write down their thoughts as they forget, make additional mistakes than normal or become restless.  On a Investigate (DC 15) they'll become aware of the quill's problematic behavior.

item.name: Ripped and torn mail links.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Ripped and torn mail links.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): They seem to glow with a royal brilliance, but do not emit any actual light.

item.name: sealed envelope made of red leather
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): sealed envelope made of red leather
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): you haven’t been able to open. It smells of campfire.

item.name: Seven small beads of sandstone on a string, all different colors.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Seven small beads of sandstone on a string, all different colors.

item.name: A bracelet made of silvered fish hooks.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A bracelet made of silvered fish hooks.

item.name: Shell
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): The shell - when placed upon their ear - softly plays (Perception DC 12) popular music for that race

item.name: Some frog legs made of ivory
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Some frog legs made of ivory
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that bounce around randomly.

item.name: Some random objects such as bones or stones that always come back together when destroyed
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Some random objects such as bones or stones that always come back together when destroyed

item.name: Some vials of liquid
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Some vials of liquid
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that create moss on anything they touch. This moss keeps growing and will eventually cover the whole thing. Then the moss withers and flakes off.

item.name: Statue of Kobold
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): An incredibly ugly kobold statue that you can't get rid of. If you sell it, leave it or give it away it always reappears next to your bed staring at you the next morning.

item.name: Stone
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This appears to be a normal stone, but when it is rubbed the stone produces the smell a specific type of baked good (pie, bread, etc) for 60ft for half an hour. While it's in effect scent based Perception checks are at absolute disadvantage. (Consider it 'double disadvantage).

item.name: Stoneware Beer Stein
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A stoneware beer stein with a pewter lid. A dwarf female fighting a Quaggoth decorates the stein, and the lid’s thumb lever is in the shape of the dwarf standing over the slain creature.

item.name: The blade of a huge axe
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The blade of a huge axe
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that feels insanely heavy to any size below huge, but huge think it is as light as a feather.

item.name: The blade of an ancient sword.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The blade of an ancient sword.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  A mysterious coat of arms is carved into it.

item.name: A broken sword hilt with strange runes on the remains of the blade
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A broken sword hilt with strange runes on the remains of the blade

item.name: The branch of a tree that caught fire when you were nearby.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The branch of a tree that caught fire when you were nearby.

item.name: The desiccated body of a small eight-legged black lizard.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The desiccated body of a small eight-legged black lizard.

item.name: The eye of a cat
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The eye of a cat
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): For some reason it commonly looks around at anything powerful.

item.name: The porcelain turtle of doubt.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The porcelain turtle of doubt.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It's a rabbit statue but for some reason everyone thinks it's really a turtle.

item.name: The symbol of a powerful religion
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The symbol of a powerful religion
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): covered in soot that stays no matter how much it is cleaned.

item.name: Three gems
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Like Ioun stones, they circle around a creatures head, sparkling and softing chiming - if the creature is of royal blood - granting such Advantage on Charisma based skills while active.

item.name: Zurkhwood comb
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A zurkhwood comb carved to look like a stylized mustache.

item.name: An old, worn smith's hammer.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An old, worn smith's hammer.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Its head is always hot to the touch.

item.name: Chicken Feather
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A feather, from a chicken... don't overthink this.

item.name: small silver bell
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): sound like quiet, distant thunder when it's struck.

item.name: A bronze oil lamp which is rumored to have once held a genie.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A bronze oil lamp which is rumored to have once held a genie.

item.name: A clockwork finch
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): flaps its wings in the presence of a breeze.

item.name: A conch shell
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): always damp and constantly drips saltwater.

item.name: A glass pendant with a hole in the center
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A glass pendant with a hole in the center
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): A mild breeze always blows out of the hole

item.name: A handful of caltrops
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A handful of caltrops
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When they touch the ground, begin to make “sad puppy noises“

item.name: A pair of silver slippers (or ruby if you want the movie version)
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A pair of silver slippers (or ruby if you want the movie version)
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Sparkle when worn and the heels clicked together

item.name: A Tiny Golden Egg
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Tiny Golden Egg
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): cannot be cracked or broken

item.name: A vial shaped like a cylinder.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A vial shaped like a cylinder.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  Any liquid put inside gets tainted blue and gains a slight taste like blue raspberry.

item.name: An eye-sized blue pearl
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An eye-sized blue pearl
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): floats in salt water.

item.name: An impossibly sharp pen
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An impossibly sharp pen
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Always be in the owner’s pocket when they reach into it.

item.name: blank piece of wet parchment
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): blank piece of wet parchment
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): never seems to dry.

item.name: A candle whose flame produces no heat nor can it be extinguished or transfer its flame
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A candle whose flame produces no heat nor can it be extinguished or transfer its flame

item.name: Flint and steel
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): when used to start a fire, creates a random colored flame.

item.name: Half of a palm-sized geode
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Half of a palm-sized geode
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  pulses dimly with purple light.

item.name: hourglass
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): sands pour upward instead of downward.

item.name: Ice Diamond
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This diamond is found sumberged in crushed ice in a specially sealed box. If it is removed from the ice it will gradually change over the next minute until it resembles a grey pebble. If submerged in crushed ice again it will quickly return to its diamond appearance.

item.name: Six Fingered Gloves
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): These gloves had room for an extra finger. (A Latin/Spaniard NPC will continue to appear - but not approach the owner of the gloves.)

item.name: Small puzzle box made of brass
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Small puzzle box made of brass
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): slightly warm to the touch.

item.name: small vial of black sand
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): small vial of black sand
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): glows slightly in the moonlight.

item.name: Terracotta Flask
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A small earthen flask which fills itself each day with cow urine.

item.name: A candlestick with a jeweler's mark stamped into the base.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A candlestick with a jeweler's mark stamped into the base.

item.name: A 1 inch Cube of a Unknown Material
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A 1 inch Cube of a Unknown Material
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Fiends have advantage on attacks against you.

item.name: A canteen filled with a foul smelling orange mud.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A canteen filled with a foul smelling orange mud.

item.name: A Card with a Picture That Looks Weirdly Like Yourself
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Card with a Picture That Looks Weirdly Like Yourself
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): An illusion of yourself is seen at the edge of your vision at times.

item.name: A Carved Tentacle
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): You reduced the attack roll for your unarmed strikes by 2.

item.name: A ceramic tile with a silvery sheen.
A chain of alternating silver and bronze links.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The silver links are ethereal, while the bronze links are not, but they can still interact with the other links.

item.name: A chalice.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): When drank from makes the drinker’s blood glow with an inner fire for a few minutes afterward.

item.name: A charred chisel with an unfamiliar symbol stamped into its base.
A chess piece fashioned to look like fire myrmidon.
A 1 Pound Egg With Black Stripes
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): The egg hatches into a black pudding that is aggressive.

item.name: A clay teapot.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): It fills itself with fresh hot tea every morning.

item.name: A pair of tailor’s shears
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): It can cut through any kind of leather.

item.name: A bean
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When planted, overnight produces a climbable beanstalk that when it seeds, makes one bean.

item.name: A cloak lined with a strange blue fur
A charred, half-melted pewter clasp
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A charred, half-melted pewter clasp
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): glows as if smoldering but releases no heat.

item.name: A clear marble
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): slowly rolls toward the nearest source of running water.

item.name: A curious talking ebony walking stick,
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A curious talking ebony walking stick,
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): well versed in history and swordplay.

item.name: A deep blue piece of flint
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A deep blue piece of flint
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): when struck with steel produces not a spark but a drop of water.

item.name: A fist sized rock
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A fist sized rock
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that “beats“ like a heart.

item.name: A fruit
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Makes you drowsy after taking a bite, always regenerates (provides no sustenance)

item.name: A glass orb
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): replicates yesterday's weather inside itself.

item.name: A quarterstaff with a small jade sphere affixed to one end.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A quarterstaff with a small jade sphere affixed to one end.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When swung, the jade leaves a faint trail of color.

item.name: A rag intended to be wrapped around the scabbard of a sword
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A rag intended to be wrapped around the scabbard of a sword
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It magically whisks away blood and other liquids from a sword as it is sheathed.

item.name: A small brass flute adorned with silver wire
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small brass flute adorned with silver wire
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It is always faintly sounding.

item.name: A clockwork device
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): that's button won't press no matter what you do.

item.name: A small collapsible silver cup
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small collapsible silver cup
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): perspires constantly when opened.

item.name: A small metal dragon.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small metal dragon.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): If you press it’s tail, it spits a small blue flame.

item.name: A stone figure of a snake
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A stone figure of a snake
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): changes positions after every full moon

item.name: hourglass
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  tells time with falling mist instead of sand.

item.name: Juggler's Balls
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): If thrown these balls will always make their way back to the thrower's hand before hitting the ground.

item.name: A Book Written by a halfling named Heroicus about the intricacies of pony breeding, includes illustrations
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Book Written by a halfling named Heroicus about the intricacies of pony breeding, includes illustrations
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Gain +10 to animal handling with horses or its kin

item.name: A bright crimson felt hat
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A bright crimson felt hat
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Makes the wearer appear more slender to all that view (illusion) but makes the wearer see themselves as more hefty/fat.

item.name: A brown scroll case that can only hold a single spell
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A brown scroll case that can only hold a single spell
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It can disppear and reappear when bearer utters the word “secrets“

item.name: A Compass
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): always points to Mulmaster.

item.name: A Cloth Doll
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A weird voice is sometimes heard in the back of your head.

item.name: A dark mahogany seed the size of a fist
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A dark mahogany seed the size of a fist
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When planted, all flora within 30ft immediately blooms, but they decay when the seed is dug up.

item.name: A Doll shaped like a Pixie
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Its bearer is immune to being knocked back or thrown.

item.name: A drinking cup
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): that randomly fills with fresh or salt water. Refilling once emptied.

item.name: A glass eyeball
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  looks about of its own accordance, and can roll around.

item.name: A Glass Jar with an Ear of Night Hag in embalming fluid
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): If exposed to starlight, all within 200ft will hear the faint sound of children wailing

item.name: A Golden Ring affixed with a tiny dark stone chisled into a cats head.
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): It purs with pleasure and graces the wearer with the use of one instance of Luck, until a short rest, whenever a being with canine bloodlines is slain in its presence.

item.name: A large transparent gem
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): when gripped tightly, whispers in Terran.

item.name: A love letter written in an ancient and forgotten tongue
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Attempts to read such causes feelings of homesickness until they make a Wisdom Save (18), until then creatures that read or heard the words (They do not need to know the language) as they have two levels of Exhaustion.

item.name: A Mask resembling the visage of an old halfling woman
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When worn the wearer sees the moment of their birth.

item.name: A Pair of crude bracers made of horse hide.
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): The bracers deflect all harmless items thrown at the wearer including ones they wish to catch.

item.name: A cloudy chunk of glass
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Holds a spark of breath from a blue dragon.

item.name: A palm-sized stone with a hole in it
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  through which can be heard a constantly whispering wind.

item.name: A paper fan
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): won't produce a breeze no matter how hard it's waved.

item.name: A Petrified red and purple starfish
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Makes the weare impervious to sea sickness or losing their footing while aboard a seafaring vessel at sea (+10 to Acrobratics checks for such).

item.name: A pouch containing an ounce of altered wolfsbane
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A pouch containing an ounce of altered wolfsbane
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Lycanthropes are drawn to the bearer

item.name: A set of dark spectacles
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Allows the wearer to see faint aurars of similar colorings encircling individuals who share a common ancestors.

item.name: A silver cup inlaid with Elvish Script
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When filled with wine it performs (+10) a single song that is etherically beautiful, when filled with anything else it scretches and gagles.

item.name: A simple metal box
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Contains a scroll of wish, but only a divine being may open it.

item.name: A small glass bird
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  when set down near water dips its head in as if to get a drink.

item.name: A small pot with yellow paste
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): The paste deals 3d6  necrotic damage to oozes when applied, or instantly ends acid/poison/damage effect. Can be applied to a medium sized creature to reverse all ooze attacks until a short or long rest.

item.name: A small stone cube
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Acts as a magnet when placed against another stone.

item.name: A coin that appears to have the same sides to everyone except you
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A coin that appears to have the same sides to everyone except you

item.name: A small vial of Vampire's blood
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small vial of Vampire's blood
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): All creatures within 5 ft radius that feed on blood are repeled (Must make a Wis 16 Save)

item.name: A small wooden doll
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): when held brings back fond memories.

item.name: A Wood Lyre with Leaf Motif
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Plays notes that only those older than 100 can hear

item.name: An Easily breakable hairpin made of jade shaped like a dragonfly
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Allows wearer to see through smoke, fog, and mist as if not there.

item.name: Boots of Multiple Steps
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Boots of Multiple Steps

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): These plain leather boots seem to have extra padding on the soles to seemingly reduce the niose of the wearer's footsteps. But any wearer will note that every step emits a cocophany of sound that echoes off surfaces that do not exist. In effect, it reduces Stealth (or whatever the games equivalent is), rolls by -10 but anyone hearing the steps have difficulty pinpointing where the sound comes from from the infinitly echoeing steps.

item.name: Box of Shadowdust
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A small black box with a tied down lid. Inside is a greyish powder that screams non-stop when it comes in contact with sunlight.

item.name: Fingerless Gloves
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Anyone that puts on these gloves feels a faint tingling in their fingers. An hour later it will be uncomfortable cramps. A further hour later, intense pain. At this point, if the gloves are removed their fingers will magically disappear.

item.name: Hoard-Coin
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A small metal coin that when flipped it will always land on its side. One per day the coin can be rolled on the floor, where it will roll toward the nearest source of significant precious metal or gems, as a “Locate Object“ spell.

item.name: Purifying Ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A regularlooking copper ring that purifies any liquid that passes through it back in to pure water. Wearing this ring is a bad idea, since it’ll purify the materials out of your blood, returning it to water.

item.name: The custom dice rolling action action figure.
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The custom dice rolling action action figure.
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): It's like a nutcracker that if you put a set of dice in it's hand an pull the lever on the back it always rolls the highest possible outcome.

item.name: A collar
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): lets a dog or cat speak in common. It doesn’t change the animal’s intelligence.

item.name: yellow gemstone
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): glows dimly when a storm is nearby.

item.name: A small vial of Vampire's blood
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small vial of Vampire's blood
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  always filled with the smell of autumn wind.

item.name: Bag of Duplication
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Put any object that can fit through a 1-foot diameter hole into this bag, and you can draw it back out, plus a duplicate. The duplicate has no value (magical items have no magic, weapons are pot-metal, coins are base metal, jewels are glass, food is non-nutritious, etc.) but they look perfect without a close inspection.

item.name: Golden Helmet of Mambrino
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): Golden Helmet of Mambrino

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This item looks like a shaving basin, but when placed on the head of a paladin, grants AC 16. But disadvantage to all Charisma saves and checks. (it still looks like a shaving basin.)

item.name: Razor of Logic
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): At a command word, this razor will instantly and safely shave anybody within 60 feet, except the barber who owns of the razor.

item.name: The Ivory Truffle Pig
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): The Ivory Truffle Pig

{@bold Features} (GM Facing): This ivory statuette of a pig can be comanded to grow to full size and find the nearest source of food, fresh water, or truffles. It can only remain active for 2 hours a day, split up as the user desires.

item.name: Bed of Alarm
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): This bed will instantly wake its occupant if any intruder enters the castle of the original owner. Note that since you don't know where that is, this means it wakes the occupant randomly, any time an animal walks across those ruins, thousands of miles away.

item.name: A pipe
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Smoke that comes from it at times makes phantasmal images for the smoke.

item.name: A ring
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Of a past poweful leader, at times it laughs at your jokes.

item.name: A Sealed Jar of Glowing Water
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Sealed Jar of Glowing Water
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The Jar is unbreakable, and hums when shaken

item.name: A compass that always points to where you were moments ago
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A compass that always points to where you were moments ago

item.name: A small crystal snowglobe
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small crystal snowglobe
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): when shaken, seems to form silhouettes of dancing forms.

item.name: A small Hand Held Mirror
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small Hand Held Mirror
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): Will answer mundane questions

item.name: A small marble
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing):  that randomly changes color.

item.name: A small model of a castle
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small model of a castle
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that matches a real one exactly and changes to match new alterations.

item.name: A small pocket mirror
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A small pocket mirror
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  slowly fogs over while held.

item.name: A small whistle
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): when blown, whispers a name  of a person or place unknown to you, instead of the whistle sound.

item.name: A snowglobe
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Shows you the Feywild version of your current location.

item.name: A soft feather
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): When dropped falls like a stone weight (bearer cannot benefit from a feather fall)

item.name: A steamer trunk
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): when opened, has your sister inside it, whether you actually remember having one or not.

item.name: A stone smoking pipe
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A stone smoking pipe
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): that never needs lighting.

item.name: A Copper Piece Carved with a Rune
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A Copper Piece Carved with a Rune
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): When you roll a natural 1 you become blinded until the end of your next turn.

item.name: A Strange Key
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): A heavy, ornate, stone key with unreadable markings. Breaks/Doesn't fit any lock... but can be used as an improvised magical weapon dealing d6 bludgeoning dmg.

item.name: A tea kettle
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): heats itself when filled with water.

item.name: A tuning fork made from a dark metal
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A tuning fork made from a dark metal
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  glows with a pale, white light during thunderstorms.

item.name: A vial of red liquid
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): A vial of red liquid
{@bold Features} (GM Facing):  that moves up or down depending on the current danger.

item.name: A woodcutter’s axe
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): the head of which shimmers like downwards-flowing water.

item.name: amulet filled with liquid
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): amulet filled with liquid
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): The liquid churns, freezes, or boils to match its wearer's mood.

item.name: An old scratched monocle
entries: {@bold Description} (Player Facing): An old scratched monocle
{@bold Features} (GM Facing): shows an underwater landscape whenever someone looks through it.

item.name: Book
entries: {@bold Features} (GM Facing): Filled with writing that only appears when the book is held underwater.

item.name: Broken Dagger
